entry.message: [info] Activation of plug-in DQC Rules Validator successful, version Check version using Tools->DQC->Version on the GUI or --dqc-version on the command line. - validate/DQC
[info] Activation of plug-in SEC Inline Transforms successful, version 19.2. - transforms/SEC

[info] Activation of package dqc_15_concepts.csv, dqc_0011.csv, dqc_0079.csv, dqc_0080.csv, dqc_0081.csv, dqc_0091_ifrs_2018_concepts.csv, dqc_0091_ifrs_2019_concepts.csv, dqc_0094.csv, dqc_0129.csv and effective_dates.csv successful. - D:\Temp\tmprw60v45j\packages\resources.zip

[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 00000006 - Statement - Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsReceivable is the correct concept, input a negative value.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/867038/000101738619000325/spnd-20190930.xml 777

property.name: label
property.value: Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activities

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept IncreaseDecreaseInOtherCurrentAssetsAndLiabilitiesNet is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 00000006 - Statement - Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. IncreaseDecreaseInOtherCurrentAssetsAndLiabilitiesNet is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. IncreaseDecreaseInOtherCurrentAssetsAndLiabilitiesNet has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and IncreaseDecreaseInOtherCurrentAssetsAndLiabilitiesNet is the correct concept, input a negative value.
Rule Element Id:7488 Rule version: 17.0.0 - http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/867038/000101738619000325/spnd-20190930.xml 777

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0043.7488] The concept IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidTaxes is included in the calculation of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. This is in the role 00000006 - Statement - Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidTaxes is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidTaxes has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidTaxes is the correct concept, input a negative value.
